Built in 1952 by a prominent and well-respected imam from the Alatas family, this old generation masjid has served the needs of university undergraduates in Bukit Timah before the campus was relocated to Kent Ridge. Today, the one-storey masjid, which is located in the Central, can accommodate up to 400 worshippers for daily and Friday prayers. It is also crowded during Hari Raya prayers. On Thursday evenings, many Muslims gather for recitation of praises to Allah.

How to get there?

171, 67, 700, 700, 77, 851, 852, 960, 961, 970, 980

Masjid Ba'alwie, with its integrated museum, offers a unique and enriching experience for visitors interested in Islamic history, culture, and heritage. Nestled within the serene ambiance of the mosque premises, the museum provides insights into the rich tapestry of Islamic traditions and contributions.

The museum showcases a diverse collection of artifacts, manuscripts, and exhibits that highlight the cultural and religious significance of Islam. From ancient manuscripts and calligraphy to historical artifacts and religious relics, each display offers a glimpse into the rich history and heritage of the Islamic world.

One of the standout features of Masjid Ba'alwie's museum is its interactive exhibits and multimedia presentations, which engage visitors of all ages and backgrounds. Through immersive experiences and informative displays, visitors can deepen their understanding of Islamic art, architecture, and spirituality.

In addition to its cultural and educational value, the museum also serves as a place of reflection and contemplation for worshippers and visitors alike. The serene ambiance of the mosque surroundings enhances the spiritual experience, allowing visitors to connect with their faith and heritage on a deeper level.

Overall, Masjid Ba'alwie's integrated museum is a testament to the enduring legacy of Islam and its contributions to humanity. Whether exploring the exhibits, participating in educational programs, or simply enjoying the tranquil atmosphere, visitors are sure to find inspiration and enlightenment within the walls of this exceptional cultural institution.
